comment: A good nose with sweetness and a light nuttiness, hits the palate with a light sweetness and finishes with oakiness. Light and finishes quick.
Sweet fruity smell, woody taste, light finish

Reviewed from a 2 oz pour.

On the nose, it has some honeyed scents with some berries. Maybe cherry. On the taste you get some strong vanilla, caramelized sugar, with some tartness on back of the tongue.  There’s a steady burn throughout. It has a short finish with some oak. 

I compared it to another wheated bourbon I had on hand: Weller Special Reserve. Similar price points (at retail). I liked Weller a bit more due to its distinct apple flavor and long finish.

Conclusion: Solid budget bourbon. Give it a chance if you’re looking for a cheap whiskey. At this price point (~$20), I’d probably buy something else. However, I wouldn’t turn it down if offered. Cheers!
Spicy notes. The more I have of this the more I like it.
On the nose it smells balanced and rich with typical bourbon notes. I kind of get a nutty note like hazelnut also. Oily and stays on the tongue.
Sweet vanilla, caramel, slight ethanol and nutty softness

So store pick, was told 8 years old but based on bottle date can't be over 7. 

Nose - distinct wheat finish, vanilla, and a hell of a lot of nutty notes. I'm a bit confused at how nutty this is, very much a heaven hill or jim beam like note. 

Taste - very light bourbon but yet i still get a bit of alcohol bite and heat. Honestly, I'm struggling to get past alcohol, nutty notes, and then on the finish vanilla and a hair of oak. There's nothing distinct here. 

Full disclosure I bought this thinking it might mix well with coke or rootbeer. It doesn't, it actually disapears to the point I can't tell there's bourbon in the glass. A great thing for a college party, but not really what I want when I'd like to have a nice summer sipper where I still can enjoy some bourbon character. 

1 star, nothing wrong with it. It's a bit spirit forward for the age and proof but i tend to find some cheaper bourbons when watered down almost seem more alcohol forward and not less. 

Not a bourbon I'd recommend to really anyone. I don't get enough wheater character to justify this as a replacement for other wheats and if you want something nutty maybe try a beam black, imo that's better juice.
Sweet with some oak spice. Short oaky finish.
It has some normal bourbon notes and then a earthy flavor comes in strong. It tastes like beets. Not a pleasant taste.
Nose reminds me of yellow cake and orange zest. Smooth and creamy, decently oily with leather and wood which fades into a mild wheat finish.

Well balanced. 
On the sweeter side. 
Lacks complexity.
Sweet with prominent wheat notes, strong citrus on the finish. Would be great for an Old Fashioned.

A readily available wheated bourbon for under 30$? Yes please! Found the nose on this one to be pretty typical. Smells like a sweeter bourbon maybe some sugar sweet notes. Taste is sweet and ends in a slight oak with very little spice and heat. Having trouble pin pointing all the different flavor notes in this one both neat and OTR but it is quite good and complex for it to be so cheap. This will be a go to bourbon in my collection for sure. This is very good.
Just enough sweet, just enough heat! And a reasonable price to boot!
Sweet with a heavy oak/spice finish
Sweet on the nose, but tastes earthy & dry. Barrel finish.
It’s pretty smooth but has a wheaty aftertaste that isn’t the best. Very strong taste even in a mixed drink
Dark Carmel coloring, slightly sweet and very smooth. Slight after burn as it rolls down your throat.
brown sugar light sweetness, sharpe bright alcohol aftertaste - lingering burn

Nose
Wheat bread, Butterscotch,

Palate
Cinnamon 
Honey
Barrel spice
The nose is somewhat lacking. Typical bourbon notes. Nothing special. On the palette I get a bit of harshness at first. However as I allow it to open up I find it more interesting.

Larceny’s nose and palate are not offensive, but nothing to write home about.  Caramel and bananas come to mind.  The palate is nutty, however somewhat bitter.  There is some nice spice on the finish, however I find it to be a bit short, possibly a reflection of the lower proof.  If you are a fan of wheaters, this may be a good bourbon to jump on.  At $23, there are very few other options that are as nice as this for the price point.

Nose - Smells like banana bread, cut grass, various floral notes.
Taste - Strong oak spice, nutty, dried grass.
Finish - Long sweetness and spice.

A nice story. That is what this dram has. This is a 4.0 because of my scoring system but it surely feels like a 3.5.

Well, "Larceny" is an english term for a non violent steal, and has a lock and a key on the bottle, next to John E. Fitzgerald name. 

Apparently, Heaven Hill discovered that John E. Fitzgerald wasn't a distiller but really a bonded treasury agent, who had the keys to a distillery. The myth says that he entered at night to the distillery and drank from the best casks. 

But this great story is not all. This Larceny Bourbon is a "wheated" bourbon. That means that it has 51% at least of corn whiskey and the rest is wheat whiskey, not having any rye on it. 

Well, bottled at 46%abv, tawny color. 

On the nose, lots of aromas, but not quite spectacular. Typical bourbon aroma but more herbal. Banana very dim not as protagonist as in other bourbons. Brown sugar, Caramel, Herbal vanilla note; Spicy but not a traditional spice: a rare more herbal cinnamon. After 5 minutes it opens to vanilla ice cream and dry cake. 

On the palate, it doesn't deliver the promise you get on the nose. Bitter dry fruits: Its like prunes but bitter, I don't know how to explain it. Nice body but too bitter,  little spicy - ginger; There is some wood influence but is clearly too young. Tobbacco and bitter coffee beans. Finish has a wet raw rice note, very long.

Overall this is interesting, might make a great mixer due to its bitterness. I give it a 80 over 100, getting exactly to the 4.0 score, eventhough it feels like a 75 over 100.

On the nose, crisp green apple and almost a sour grape note. 

On the pallet, slightly nutty and the apple note sweetens, with a little vanilla. 

The finish is wheaty with honey, and the vanilla strengthens. 

Overall, a great choice for the cost.
Really good wheat whiskey. Smooth. Good bang for your buck!
Sweet to the tongue, smell of vanilla
Not bad. A bit hot and pretty straightforward. Not overly complex. Nuttier than expected.
Loved it. A little strong at first but much better after one or two
It’s fine. Taste description is spot on.
Similar to Heaven's Door, but a little more spice.  Reminds me of honey nut cheerios with a little spice.
Aroma - Nutty and fruity / taste - classic bourbon flavors. Vanilla and oak. / Finish - finishes strong, you can taste the char but it is not overwhelmingly spicy.
Very sweet, smooth.  Overall low on flavor. Too sweet
Sugar and nuts with a banana bread aroma on the nose. Oak and spice on the tongue with sweetness overtaking heat on the finish. Enjoyable neat!

This particular expression I tried was a Barrel Select from a local liquor store.  I was genuinely very surprised by this bourbon.  It was much friendlier than I was expecting it to be.  For the price, I was expecting it to be a little harsh and pretty thin in terms of flavor.  But, it actually overs a good amount.  It's sweet and silky with a water-like consistency and mouthfeel.  The flavor of sweet corn persists throughout.  This bourbon is among the sweetest I've had which might be a turn-off for some, but I love most kinds of bourbon and this one is very deserving.  For me, this would be a fantastic dumb reach bourbon because it isn't that expensive so you don't have to feel bad for drinking it frequently, and it isn't challenging to drink whatsoever.  Looking for a casual drinker for when you just want a bourbon to casually sip, this is one I highly recommend.
A little heat on the front end
Honey, sweet, and smooth. Great value.
Great wheated bourbon! Nothing too hot given the proof of the juice. Good notes of honey come through. Overall just nice and smooth. Easy substitute when you can't find Buffalo Trace around.
Soft and light, with a slight peanut character. The wheat character definitely sweatens things up.

This is a fun, sweet bourbon to have on hand. The nose is a honey sweetness with spicy vanilla, maraschino cherry, orange zest, and a wheat breadiness that especially shows up in blind tasting flights. If you find the wheat bread note you can instantly pick it out. On the taste, there is an apple note that plays well with the strong honey and round grain notes. The finish is where the oak char and a peanut-shell nuttiness comes through.

Nose: ripe fruit and floral. 
Palate: peppery spices, maybe licorice 
Finish: slightly acidic. Quick finish
Tasting alone on the rocks.  Easy to drink, wheaty bourbon.  Finishes smooth but does leave a filmy aftertaste.  A solid inexpensive bottle to put on your shelf.
Nice tasting at a reasonable price
Sweeter than Maker's Mark but similar is  taste.
Some caramel and oak.  Medium to longer finish
I really enjoyed this. First sip, is heated, but after the next few sips, it is really smooth.
It's got strong enough vanilla it makes a great mixer. I don't particularly care for it neat, though.
Vanilla and cinnamon on the nose, spicy oak on the palate
Harsh, Smokey cigar flavor. Slight hints of spicy cinnamon, lacks much depth.
A bit strong to drink neat in my opinion, but great for cocktails.
On the sweeter side, easy drinker
Nothing stands out about this- serviceable, good enough, etc. but probably something I'll use for mixed drinks going forward.
On the sweet side. Not too hot. Solid all around bourbon.
Nutty nose, spice initially on palate with sweetness on the back

Thin quick legs and light amber.  Nose on a very old, misty empty bottle is a bit like whole grain pancakes and maple syrup.  There’s a hint of oak and mint with some ethanol on the end.  It’s smooth.  Lightly toasted oak, caco and maple come through.  There’s a tinge of something like leather on the end.  It’s an interesting and easy palate to sip but not overly complex or satisfying.  Good for beginners and can’t imagine mixing it into much...  kind of like the wheated equivalent of Basil Hayden.
Easy to drink and not bad to sip on. Nothing particularly special about it but also no overly apparent flaws. I also got a 5 dollar rebate on the bottle so the price was right:)
I'm a sucker for those wheated bourbons. Larceny is full, slightly sweet, with a rich feel in the mouth. A little heat with a lovely finish.
Tasty, wheated, punches above it's price point

Larceny Small Batch Bourbon is a wheated, hand selected six-year-old Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey. The mashbill consists of corn, wheat, and malted barley however, we do not know the percentages. This 92 proof/46% ABV bourbon is incredibly approachable, especially for beginners to bourbon. Albeit it will not wow anyone, nor is it anything close to superb, this whiskey is very consistent and a solid bourbon for the very affordable price.

Color: Brown Gold

At looking at the glass there was slow steady legs sliding down the glass. Before even nosing, I could smell the delightfully sweet aromas from the wheated bourbon. After further exploration I found hints of cinnamon, buttery biscuits, syrup, peaches, and brown sugar on the nose. When I took a sip, hints of brown butter, biscuits, slight spice, vanilla, and toffee exploded on the palate, but in a good way. The finish is medium to long and rather dry, with hints tobacco, charred oak, and toffee.
Liquid candy for the bourbon drinker. Sweet and smooth, with noticeable wheat rounding out the experience. Some might consider it a bit too streamlined but I'm enjoying the experience.

Sweet on the nose, bitter type of citrus peel or orange peel, spice
Initial sweet taste, oak, finish with orange peel and some tannins

Pretty straightforward. Pretty smooth and sweet, as it’s a wheated bourbon. Good neat. Good proof too. For the price, I’d vote it’s one of the best you can get, though if you spend $10 more you can likely find something a touch better.

Lighter, slightly sweeter than a standard bourbon. What I was in the mood for today which really helps this taste better right now. Overall not very complex, but if you like a sweeter, lighter flavor then this is a good pick.

Nose: Nutty with stone fruit and banana
Palate: Yeasty, more banana bread and oak
Finish: smooth and quick. Doesn’t linger long
Very corn husky and peppery Almost a rye.
Smells sweet with pumpkin notes. The taste is spicy cinnamon and licorice. The burn is hot but quick. Good for keeping the mind sharp on a late night.

(Blind vs. Maker's Mark) 
As mentioned in my Maker's review, like many Maker's was a gateway bourbon for me.  As I've become more of a bourbon fan, I hear all the experts speak about Larceny and how much of a great Maker's substitute it is...  (boom - Blind!)
As I drank this, I was convinced it was Maker's. Convinced - I thought the other was more complex and this was formulated to be muted for the mass market. I was wrong.
Aroma was of straight corn grain and a touch dusty.  Light Oak.

Flavor - Honey, cinnamon and toasted bread. Then Corn Flakes and a touch of caramel.  Smooth front to back.  No finish to speak of. (Finish is my favorite) 
3 Drops of water really helped open this.  Straight to more Corn, more cereal and some light baking spice.
Sweet vanilla/cinnamon/carmel candle smell, soft dull taste at first then has a rush of flavor at the end which gives a sweet but ultimately salty moderate length finish - somewhat like a pretzel
Easy drinking with sweet lingering finish

2nd time review enjoying neat

Nose - sugar, sweetness, cherries, light oak smell. 

Taste - as soon as this hits the tongue it’s sweet. I get sugar immediately. Cherries and vanilla come to my palate as well as it coats my tongue. The finish is more sweetness and a deep sugar with some oak and a very slight burn of spice. Dang this is a good treat tasting bourbon.

Overall and value - you cannot beat this bourbon if you like an easy drinker and something sweet. I personally love all aspects of this bourbon and it’s easily found under 30$. Adds a lot of value when it’s cheap and easy to find. Must buy for anyone who prefers a sweet bourbon
Sugar and wood dominate here. A somewhat "strong" tasting bourbon. There is a lot to like here, if only it had more depth.
